method.name: ChiMerge Discretizer

reference.ref: R. Kerber. ChiMerge: Discretization of Numeric Attributes. 10th National Conference on Artifical Intelligence American Association for Artificial Intelligence (AAAI92). San Jose, California (USA, 1992) 123-128

generalDescription.objective: To transform a set of numerical variables into nominal variables. Input variables may be either real or integer.
generalDescription.howWork:
ChiMerge Discretizer is an algorithm that discretizes the non nominal attributes (real or integer) of a group of instances.
The task of a discretization algorithm is to build a set of intervals for each non nominal attribute. The value of the attribute is translated to the interval number to which the value belongs.
ChiMerge Discretizer is a statistic heuristic method for supervised discretization. In the initialization step it places each observed real value into its own interval. The X2 test is used to test the hypothesis that the class attribute is independent of the two adjacent intervals. Depending on the result, the intervals should be merged.

parameterSpec.param: confidenceThreshold: This real value is a significance level used to calculate the X2 threshold. This value, 0.5 by default, can be determined by the user.
